movies.title: The Laughing Woman
movies.plot: A rich and sadistic man, who enjoys degrading women as part of elaborate S&M games, abducts a female journalist. She is subjected to his unpleasant games but soon begins subverting him.
movies.simplePlot: A rich and sadistic man, who enjoys degrading women as part of elaborate S&M games, abducts a female journalist. She is subjected to his unpleasant games but soon begins subverting him.

biography.bio: Philippe Leroy was born on October 15, 1930 in Paris, France. He is an actor, known for Le Trou (1960), The Night Porter (1974) and La Femme Nikita (1990). He has been married to Silvia Tortora since September 1, 1990. They have two children.
biography.name: Philippe Leroy

biography.placeOfBirth: Prague, Protectorate Bohemia and Moravia [now Czech Republic]
biography.bio: Dagmar Lassander was born on June 16, 1943 in Prague, Protectorate Bohemia and Moravia as Dagmar Regine Hader. She is an actress, known for The House by the Cemetery (1981), Blood Brides (1970) and Forbidden Photos of a Lady Above Suspicion (1970).
biography.name: Dagmar Lassander

biography.bio: Lorenza Guerrieri was born on April 18, 1944 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. She is an actress, known for The Laughing Woman (1969), La vieille fille (1972) and La vie en miettes (1989).
biography.name: Lorenza Guerrieri

biography.bio: Varo Soleri is an actor, known for The Laughing Woman (1969), La pietà di novembre (1968) and I bambini ci amano (1955).
biography.name: Varo Soleri

biography.bio: Maria Cumani Quasimodo was born on January 7, 1908 in Caldé, Castelveccana, Varese, Lombardy, Italy. She was an actress, known for Turn the Other Cheek (1974), Les subversifs (1967) and Toutes les couleurs du vice (1972). She was married to Salvatore Quasimodo. She died on November 22, 1995 in Milan, Lombardy.
biography.name: Maria Cumani Quasimodo

biography.bio: Mirella Pamphili is an actress, known for The Great Silence (1968), Kill Baby, Kill (1966) and Django Kill... If You Live, Shoot! (1967).
biography.name: Mirella Pamphili
